value: Empezar una partida en modo un jugador
El modo multijugador esta desactivado en la demo
Escribe el Nombre del personaje para confirmar
Desactivar efecto de resplandor en las armas
Mostrar etiqueta [HOST] en el personaje del Administrador
Ocultar Notificacion de Puntos de estadisticas
Ocultar Notificacion de puntos de Habilidad
Bandera para PvP si esta disponible
You can't really see what this is until you buy it.
No puedes saber realmente que es hasta que lo compres.
A sigil to indicate a new soul's introduction to the world.
Used to read harder-- now with color!
Clears the mind, putting things at ease.
Can you handle the madness that ensues?
Banished crown from the nether realms.
The true fool is the enemy of the caster...
A crown worn by a Slime Diva. Contains unusual power.
Cultists are seen to wear this.
Once worn by a brave warrior.
A long forgotten heirloom of Lord Zuulneruda.
Keeps you warm in the cold weather.
Rug for the feet of the dead.
You feel strong like a golem wearing this.
You can hear the laughter from the skull motif.
Ancient silk cloth. This could've been around since the very beginning of time...
The patterns on the cloth make an audible hum if you listen closely.
Dazzling gems flicker on this loose but defensive chestpiece.
Bend the knee, to the King!
Robe of the higher elite occult.
Devout mystic sages of ancient times worn these in ceremonies.
Sturdy enough to widthstand some further damage.
Wearing these make your legs feel numb.
Emblem of the twisted nether realm.
Used by ancient warriors of the past.
An emblem of an ancient sarcophogus.
Something strikes you about this ring.
It was once possible to get this. If you have it, you must've been around for a while...
Whispers of Zuulneruda's memories echo and reverberate inside your soul.
The pearls chime, providing a peace of mind and clarity.
Slither through and past the doors.
The tail of the fish on this ring moves rapidly.
Whispers of Kaluuz's memories echo and reverberate inside your soul.
The gems glimmer much like the gems of a Colossus.
The emerald glistens even from afar.
Sounds of the ocean waves through your ears.
Forged by a sadistic being of torture.
Hot, hot, hot to the touch!
Iron Katars that have been dulled by slime.
These ears of a Slimek seem to be usable for combat...
You feel a surge of swiftness holding this bow.
Lost souls of the damned are welded to this bow.
Sharp and twisted. Fires arrows that pierce.
Ruination of the lost frozen souls.
Glue-like soot keeps the bones together.
The bones holding this bow together seem fresh.
The construct of this bow is similar of a Mekboar.
Don't you have anything better to kill?
A Rude Blade, but more... vile.
Forged from corrupted frost, formally used by ancient sages.
Looks to be an Iron Sword, but the blade is intensely dulled by slime.
The sharped blade was a bone of a madman.
Looks to have a worn out blade, but still sharp enough for it to do some damage.
Whispers of the dead are sealed in this sword.
Made with the bones of sinners.
The highest tier of a Geist's scythe.
This was wedged deep into a Deadwood. Origins of the cause is a mystery.
The blade of the axe is forever frigid.
The only best friend of a Mini Geist. The blade emanates menacingly.
An Iron Axehammer that's seen better days. It's a little bit of a challenge to maintain a grip on this thing.
The souls of the damned resonate within the blade.
A usable partisan with a Mekboar's spear attached to it.
Blood of the sinners coat this weapon.
Used by the royal guard of the undead.
The tip of the spear looks bloody, but it appears to be a corrosive material.
Poke and prod the undead into submission.
Only a Slime Diva can truly maximize the full potential of this Scepter.
It's hard to comprehend how terrible the malformed skull is.
Warmth eminates from the bright white gems.
The bell tolls for the dead.
Used to awaken Geistlords with its spine chilling tone.
Pieces of a Colossus are embedded into this bell.
The weapon is made of wood, but it chimes as if it's metal.

<color=lime>Can only be used in a Safe Zone.</color>\n\nReading this tome teaches you to be the <color=lime>nimble Bandit class.</color> Additionally resets and reimburses your Skill Points. Not reversible.

<color=lime>Can only be used in a Safe Zone.</color>\n\nReading this tome teaches you to be the <color=red>fierce Fighter class.</color> Additionally resets and reimburses your Skill Points. Not reversible.

<color=lime>Can only be used in a Safe Zone.</color>\n\nReading this tome teaches you to be the <color=cyan>wise Mystic class.</color> Additionally resets and reimburses your Skill Points. Not reversible.
A vial of blue dye. Use it to make your gear dye color blue.
A vial of green dye. Use it to make your gear dye color green.
A vial of grey dye. Use it to make your gear dye color grey.
A vial of red dye. Use it to make your gear dye color red.
Teaches the user Heavy Melee Mastery.
Potent mixture of grounded ghostly substance. Vanishes the user for a short duration.
Clenching this star gives a sudden boost of energy.
The knowledge this Tome provides gives a sizable pile of experience to the reader.
The knowledge this Tome provides gives a massive pile of experience to the reader.
The knowledge this Tome provides gives a handful of experience to the reader.
Reading this tome resets all of your Attributes, reimbursing your Attribute Points. <color=lime>Can only be used in a Safe Zone.</color>
Reading this tome unlearns all your Skills, reimbursing all your spent Skill Points. <color=lime>Can only be used in a Safe Zone.</color>
Has capabilities to change a weapon damage scale to dexterity.
Instantly revives the holder if they die.
The inside is very hot, containing a burning blue flame that never seems to go out.
The spores can frostbite something. Could be good to keep a room cool.
The foot of a corrupted sage. The blood that drips from it quickly becomes a magical powder.
There are magic glyphs on this note. They seem to slowly float above the parchment.
Hot orange energy eminates within this log.
Too big to wear, though quite valuable.
Has capabilities to change a weapon damage scale to mind.
Shaking the bell doesn't make any noise.
Bottled spectral ashes of a restless ghost.
The once functioning heart of a Golem. Quite heavy.
A red mist twists and turns within this gem.
This magical stone can be used to change the appearance of things.
There's a glare of anxiety in the dilated pupil.
The snout continues to pulse and wiggle around.
It is unknown how this spear was attached to a boar.
Has capabilities to change a weapon damage scale to strength.
The heart of a Monolith. Dark green energy pulsates from within it.
A hefty, green gem from a Monolith. Perhaps it is mutated.
The tip of the tooth endlessly drips a little bit of poison.
Squishy. Though, it can't be popped.
The eyes are bloodshot and filled with rage.
The bloodstain on this spear means deadly business.
The spores can set something on fire. Could be good to cook something spicy with.
Just an ordinary rock. Could be tossed at enemies.
Extremely large and long ears. Unlike other slime ears, these are not sharp to the touch, but rather soft.
These are somehow sharp on the ends, which can actually hurt.
Even sharper than normal Slime ears.
The swirly pupil rotates if you look at it long enough.
Allows the holder to revive a fallen soul.\n<color=cyan>To revive someone, press the interact key when nearby them.</color>
Teeming with electricity. Too big of a weapon to use on your own.

Ah... Veo que estas listo, Y tu alma brilla mas que nunca. Porfavor, No temas. Este lugar es tu hogar, nuestro hogar. Antes de que empiezes en tu viaje, porfavor familiarizate con el santuario... Despues de todo, Este es el ulitmo lugar seguro que tiene este mundo roto. Vuelve conmigo despues de que veas el portal del mundo, los cuarteles, la tienda, Y la entrada del santuario exterior. Y por supuesto, Tomate tu tiempo...

It's quite dire, you see... the <color=cyan>Catacombs outside Sanctum</color> was a place I could commune my mystic energies with to survey the undead. What goes on there now has been all a mystery to me...

<color=cyan>When the world shattered, so did my magic.</color> Fortunately, I can still feel the lost magic existing...

<color=yellow>Find the stray Sigil deep within the Catacombs and let it tether to your soul.</color> Once you do, we can further explore what looms ahead of us... I do fear for the worst.

<color=cyan>During the night,</color> the Wisps from the Catacombs nearby disturb the Outer Sanctum. Some Greater Wisps may also be found deeper within the Catacombs itself...

<color=yellow>Abolish 8 Lesser Wisps and 5 Greater Wisps.</color>
Be careful, because <color=cyan>Wisps can curse you...</color>

The Slimes are quite the nuisance outside Sanctum... Fending them off would help us greatly.\n\n<color=cyan>Slimes are commonly found during the daytime.</color> <color=yellow>Gather 5 Slime Cores, 5 Slime Ears and kill 10 Slimes.</color> Come back safely...

Ah! There you are, little one. I've noticed that your skill has exceeded beyond where you began... <color=cyan>perhaps, you may be interested in embracing the studies of a Mystic?</color>

If you are sure to follow my warmth of wisdom and guidance, <color=yellow>I will bestow a tome that will bind my powers to you...</color> And of course, make your choice wisely, <color=yellow>as you cannot revert it.</color>

Hmm... O-Oh, yes! <color=yellow>If you happen to lose your tome while undecided, please talk to me again to retrieve another.</color>

Have you used Magic Bells before, little one? They are quite mysterious... well, they were mysterious. Fortunately for us, I have uncovered the secrets to use them at their maximum power! Take this scroll. Reading it will teach you to charge and release powerful magic beyond comprehension... Ah, right... in any case if your mind changes, return to me, and I can provide to you as many scrolls as you need... Keep in mind, the skill scroll will vanish if you drop it.

After many years of intensive studying, <color=cyan>I have uncovered the secrets of utilizing Magic Scepters!</color> Little one, would you be interested in learning them as well? <color=yellow>If so, I can provide you this skill scroll.</color> 


<color=cyan>Use it, and you will understand how to sharpen your mind to such weapons...</color>

<color=yellow>Oh yes, if you change your mind, return to me, and I can provide to you as many scrolls as you need... Keep in mind, the skill scroll will vanish if you drop it.</color>

The world is healing, little one... We must see what lies futher beyond and press on. <color=cyan>If memory serves, there is a portal in the Effold Terrace leading to an Ancient Keep. Within the east and west wing chambers, there are sigils that must be attuned to your soul.</color> Please be prepared for what may dwell there...

It's concerning, little one. <color=cyan>There are droves of ancient Golems roaming around Crescent Keep,</color> and they are quite hostile... 

The Golems were once peaceful constructs that fended off monsters, but now they have turned to aid them instead. <color=cyan>I can only assume that the shattering of the world caused this, and the gems held in their heads drove them into madness...</color> Either way, I must study this matter. 

<color=yellow>Defeat 15 Golems small and large, and collect 15 of their gems.</color> A reward for your troubles will be in order...

The Sanctum Catacombs isn't what you remember, little one... In fact, the true incantation of the Catacombs is open for us to see, and it's quite dire. I understand that you may have been through so much, but I know that you can do this! The only way to keep the Catacombs from getting worse, is to satiate the madness by defeating the forces of undead in it's worst form... Please return to me once you have done this task... I greatly urge you to bring healing items with you in this journey!

<color=cyan>The Crescent Grove is teeming with corruption...</color> As sad as it is to see how it's turned this way, it must be held back from getting worse. 

<color=cyan>I know that you are more than capable to provide the purification to this corrupted grove, little one.</color>

<color=yellow>From the beginning to the end of the Crescent Grove, slay all the monsters that dwell within it.</color> As you know, they reside in the hazy dark magic, and only appear when you come near them. 

<color=cyan>Return to me once you have swept the grove from evil, and I will bestow a reward to you...</color>

Since ancient times, the Crescent Keep was held in high regard amongst our kind for generations... 

<color=cyan>When the world shattered, the cause of the Crescent Keep's demise was from an unfathomable corruption.</color> The souls from other worlds who settled there did not live as long as they hoped, and the druids of our kind became corrupt abominations.

<color=yellow>You can find the Crescent Grove deep in the Crescent Keep, at the East wing. A door should open once you're near it. Find the stray sigil in the Crescent Grove, and tether it to your soul.</color> The monsters that lurk the grove are mighty! Please be prepared, little one.

Slimes ambushed you in the Catacombs? Well then... it's possible that I can quickly piece this issue together.

With the ward restored by your lovely soul, the portal leading to the Effold Terrace should be open to you now.

<color=cyan>The portal is located northeast of the Catacombs entrance.</color> From what I see in the Terrace, it's infested with filthy Slimeks. Unlike ordinary slimes, they are stronger and infused with tar.

<color=yellow>Slay 15 Slimeks, then return to me safely...</color>

Hmph, those nasty Slimeks don't seem to quit. The <color=cyan>Effold Terrace</color> could benefit by some immediate cleanup... \n\nPerhaps you could do me a favor and show them a little force of your skill? <color=yellow>Slay about 20 Slimeks,</color> and return to me when you can...

It looks like you have done a great deal of damage to the Queen's hive of Slimeks... By proving your strength against her deluded offense, it's time to take her on while the iron is still hot.

From what the ley energies that surround the Terrace suggest, <color=cyan>the Queen would appear if her children continued to die...</color>

Perhaps where there are more Slimeks, that is where she may be hidden. I trust that you can fend her off and teach her a lesson, hm?

Hm... oh! I understand that the Catacombs may have been challenging to you, yes? O-Oh...? No? Well... in case if you didn't know, it seems as though the Catacombs shifts its form each time you enter. The portal leading into them is corrupted, always changing what happens within. I know you're up to the task, little one... Sweep out the evil that resides inside the Catacombs, from the start to the end. Return to me once you have done this challenge normally... and of course, please be safe.

Your soul is as strong as ever, little one. Why don't we try something a little more... well, daring? There is a small passage tucked away within the Outer Sanctum, swarming with awful creatures known as Mekboars. They brand devastating weapons on their heads, looking to pick a fight with anyone who treads on their turf... If you would, display your skill by slaying 20 Mekboars and gather 15 of their spears. Return to me when you have...

You'll soon be bearing witness to an atrocity, lost one. <color=cyan>The Sanctum Catacombs nearby have been stirring up noise for a while now.</color> I do not have the time or patience to put up with their nonsense. 

This is your first challenge to prove your worth to this world. <color=yellow>Make haste to the Catacombs, and slay 10 Mini Geists alongside 2 Geists.</color> I will see that you will be worthy for the further tasks ahead once you have done this test. 

<color=cyan>Speak to Angela for further instructions if you haven't done so. Without her assistance, you will not gain entry to the Catacombs.</color>

You seem to be using your strength rather well, lost one. <color=yellow>Take this scroll.</color> <color=cyan>Reading it will allow you to bolster your power using one-handed melee weapons.</color> Focus well, and you will be able to charge attack and jump attack against your enemies with devastating force.\n\n<color=yellow>Come back to me anytime if you reconsider your choice. I will provide as many scrolls as you need. Remember that your scroll will vanish if you lose it.</color>

<color=cyan>It takes immense strength to use heavy weapons, lost one.</color> I see that you have potential in using them. <color=yellow>If you think you can handle this burden of war, take this scroll.</color> <color=cyan>Reading it will teach you what there is to know in smashing your foes into bloody pieces.</color>\n\n<color=yellow>Come back to me anytime if you reconsider your choice. I will provide as many scrolls as you need. Remember that your scroll will vanish if you lose it.</color>

Polearms bring me back to a nostalgic time of training. Much like other melee weapons, <color=cyan>they are viable tools of war.</color> I see a spark in your eye, lost one. <color=yellow>Take this scroll, as it will teach you to apply higher skill to your use of polearms.</color>\n\n<color=yellow>Come back to me anytime if you reconsider your choice. I will provide as many scrolls as you need. Remember that your scroll will vanish if you lose it.</color>

The time has come to make the ultimate decision, lost one. I see that the strength and skill you have gathered has been more than sufficent <color=cyan>to bring forth your true colors of becoming a Fighter.</color>

Becoming a Fighter will make you a living threat against the evil monstrosities that coat this world. <color=yellow>Take this tome.</color> Once read, you will join me in our effort to divide the darkness.

<color=yellow>If you happen to lose your tome undecided, return to me. I can provide as many as you need.</color> <color=cyan>Keep in mind, reading this tome is irreversible.</color>

The time is now, lost one. <color=cyan>The Sanctum Catacombs finally uncovered its true self, and the moment to strike where the undead least expect it is here.</color> As foolish and aimless as they are, the undead in this incantation are ruthless in their power.

These monstrosities must be stopped before they aim to further corrupt our land. <color=yellow>Slay 15 Miasma, 10 Hellsludge, and 20 Poltergeists. You can find them in the hardest Sanctum Catacombs.</color> Let the undead suffer our wrath, no survivors.

<color=cyan>The Crescent Grove is a malice to this world.</color> The creatures that swarm within the grove are not up to snuff to our standards, lost one. Silence them, and put their corrupted minds to rest.

<color=yellow>Destroy 20 Deadwoods, 10 Carbuncles, 10 Red and Blue Minchrooms, and 15 Monoliths.</color> Return to me at once when your task is completed.

The Rageboars in Tuul Valley are cowards. To think they can stand a chance against us is laughable.

<color=cyan>Deep in the Valley is a temple, overrun with the damn things.</color> These devious boars were constructed by an ominous evil being that has no remorse for this world. We will discuss of her when your time is ready, lost one. For now, we must focus on what you can handle.

<color=yellow>Slay 20 Rageboars. They are hidden within the temple I have spoken of, in Tuul Valley.</color> Be advised that going deep in the temple can get you killed if you're not careful.

I see that you have aligned yourself well against the foes in Crescent Keep. Good work, lost one. <color=cyan>It is time now to take a step further beyond the Keep, to the Crescent Grove.</color> What you will witness there is a foul swarm of dark magics, with many of our fallen kind from ages past embracing the corruption.

There are two brothers, whom I was once familiar with. They are now wicked Carbuncles, meeting the same fate the others have. <color=cyan>The brothers created a golem, one that is capable of tearing the world asunder.</color> We must put an end to their cowardice. <color=yellow>Destroy the Colossus, then return to me.</color>

<color=yellow>If you haven't done so, speak to Angela. She can guide you to the Crescent Grove.</color>

<color=cyan>The Sanctum Catacombs is a never ending hellscape, driven in a goal to bring Sanctum to its knees.</color> Fortunately for us, they're too stupid to realize who they're dealing with. The amount of patience I have with these pathetic creatures is running thin.

<color=cyan>With the privledge of my strength imbued with your soul, we can make the undead scream in agony together.</color> <color=yellow>Slay 15 Toxins, 10 Deathgels, and 20 Geists. You can find them in the normal Sanctum Catacombs.</color> This should be a humourous reminder for the undead to know exactly who controls this land.

Listen. Do you hear it? There's a faint sound of laughter in the distance, coming from the Catacombs. Within it is an entity that is the manifestation that continues to reanimate the dead. This entity is named Lord Zuulneruda. A "Geistlord", one of the higher elites in the undead ranks. He must be purged. Seek Zuulneruda, and kill him. He is hidden within the medium layer of the corrupted portal. Hurry, lost one... time is of the essence. Return to me when his blood is in your hands. [Defeat Lord Zuulneruda in the (LV6-12) Sanctum Catacombs.]

Y'know, I could use somethin' of your help, if ya don't mind! <color=cyan>If you're up to it, I'll let you in on a secret too-- but keep it on the hush hush!</color>

I'm lookin' for a special combination of ghostly goods, <color=cyan>the type that can be mixed into a fine lil' powder that makes you invisible!</color> 

If ya could, <color=yellow>fetch me some Ghostdusts from them undead fellas, and a handful of those weird lil' collars the Geists wear from the Catacombs!</color>

Come back when ya got a good amount of em', ya hear?

<color=cyan>Oh! Make sure ya speak to Angela before ya head on over' there! She can open the way into the Catacombs real easy!</color>

Mmm-hm! What'd ya think of that powder, hun? Pretty nifty, right? Say, if ya want summore, how bout' you fetch some Ghostdust and Geist Collars? I won't be needin' as many as before. Keepin' mind-- the Sanctum Catacombs is the best place to get the stuff! Bring me... about 20 Ghostdusts and 8 Geist Collars, and I'll whip up nother' batch for ya! I'll make it bigger too.

Well look at that! Haven't ya been busy? I've been meanin' to let ya in on somethin', but it'll only be between us and a spare few! I take it ya like shiny things-- coins and loot? Or maybe disorienting your foes? I can help ya with that... Believe it or not, I am the Bandit Guardian! We all work hard for our business, even if it takes certain methods to get our way. Take this, and consider joining me and my crew! Keepin' mind ya can't revert your choice. If ya lose your tome, come back again!

<color=cyan>You've been at the Crescent Keep, right?</color> Last I've heard, that place is swarmin' with those lil' halitosis-ridden critters! We're not sure what to call em', <color=cyan>so we just call em' Mouths to keep things simple.</color>

Maybe we can make somethin' just to give them a taste of their own breath! <color=yellow>Bring me a Rude Blade, 5 Mouth Bitterteeth, 3 Slimek Eyes, and 10 Deathgel Cores!</color> We'll make that blade as vile as they are, hun!

<color=cyan>You can find a Rude Blade in the Crescent Keep, Slimeks in the Effold Terrace, and Deathgels in the normal Sanctum Catacombs!</color>

<color=cyan>Ya ever see those strange Wizboars, hun?</color> Those fellas always look so happy. Believe me though, they're vicious lil' things!

Maybe we can build a smaller, but easier to use scepter that functions like one of theirs, yeah? <color=yellow>Bring me 1 Wizboar Scepter, 5 Blightwood Sticks and 5 Blightwood Logs!</color> Ya up to it?

<color=cyan>Ready to make another Vile Blade?</color> Alright!

<color=yellow>Bring me a Rude Blade, 5 Mouth Bitterteeth, 3 Slimek Eyes, and 10 Deathgel Cores!</color>

<color=cyan>You can find a Rude Blade in the Crescent Keep, Slimeks in the Effold Terrace, and Deathgels in the normal Sanctum Catacombs!</color>

Interested in makin' another Wizwand? We can do that! It'll take the same amount of stuff, juust lettin' ya know. Bring me 1 Wizboar Scepter, 5 Blightwood Sticks and 5 Blightwood Logs! We'll get ya covered.

Hm! Well wouldn't ya know? I didn't think' I'd be offering such a thing, but I'll let you in on it. 

Way back then, I was always fightin' to dominate in the business, makin' sure things were gettin' taken care of. <color=cyan>In that time, I used special techniques usin' katars!</color> Sharp lil' things, able to slice and knock out competition in a heartbeat!

If you'd be interested in knowing some of that skill, I can teach ya! <color=yellow>Take this scroll. It'll give ya the boost you'd need to pummel them runts into the dirt!</color>

<color=yellow>In case ya wanna think' it over twice, I'm always here to give another scroll if ya need it! Just know that the scroll will vanish if ya drop it, ya hear?</color>

<color=cyan>Ever thought you'd be interested in the know-how on usin' ranged weapons?</color> It may come as a shock to you hun, but I know my way around usin' em and takin' down things when the job needs to be done! Ranged weapons have been a lifesaver for me and my crew!

If you'd be interested in knowing some of that skill, I can teach ya! <color=yellow>Take this scroll. Learnin' it can give you the ability to use ranged weapons at their best potential!</color>

<color=yellow>In case ya wanna think' it over twice, I'm always here to give another scroll if ya need it! Just know that the scroll will vanish if ya drop it, ya hear?</color>

<color=cyan>Them Golems in Crescent Keep are strong buggers!</color> Maybe we can take their cores and gems, make somethin' neat outta it! It'd be a chestpiece, a pretty strong one too!

<color=yellow>Bring on over 10 Golem Cores, and 15 Golem Gems,</color> and we'll get that chestpiece made!

Oh? <color=cyan>Lookin' to make another Golem Chestpiece?</color> I'm gonna be needin' the same materials for it then, hun!

<color=yellow>Bring on over 10 Golem Cores and 15 Golem Gems,</color> and we'll get that chestpiece made!

Hm, yep! Ya made a Mekspear before, I remember! <color=cyan>Wanna take it to the next level? Y'know, we could...</color>

<color=yellow>Head on over to Tuul Valley, and wrangle them Rageboars for one of their spears!</color> They're a lil' tougher than what you've fought before, so stay focused, hun!

<color=yellow>I'll need some hellsludge cores too, bout' 15 of them, to keep it all together. They're from them Hellsludges in the hardest Sanctum Catacombs. Make sure ya got a Mekspear on hand too!</color>

<color=cyan>Lookin' to make another Ragespear, hun?</color> Alright! Here's what we're gonna' need:

<color=yellow>1 Mekspear, 1 Rageboar Spear, and 15 Hellsludge Cores!</color>

<color=cyan>Ya can find them Rageboars in Tuul Valley, and Hellsludges in the hardest Sanctum Catacombs.</color> Goodluck!

Still got that lil' Golem Chestpiece we made a while back? Lemme tell ya, there's a way to make it even better! In the Crescent Grove, there's a much, much stronger type of Golem that dwells there. They are some real nasty buggers! Let's make a strong chestpiece outta their materials! Bring me... a Golem Chestpiece, 15 Monolith Cores, 10 Monolith Gems, and lastly, 5 Cursed Notes from them Carbuncles in the Grove! Whaddya say?

Ah! Lookin' for another Monolith Chestpiece, hm? Okay! Here's what we'll need for it: Bring me... a Golem Chestpiece, 15 Monolith Cores, 10 Monolith Gems, and lastly, 5 Cursed Notes from them Carbuncles in the Grove! Whaddya say?

Heya hun'! <color=cyan>I've been thinkin' of somethin we could make. Perhaps somethin' like a powerful spear!</color> Y'know, them Mekboars look like they got somethin fierce with them spears on their lil' heads.

How bout this, give me... say, <color=yellow>1 spear from them Mekboars, and 15 Slimek Cores to keep it all together.</color> I'll make a nice partisan for ya in return. Sound good?

<color=cyan>Lookin' to make another Mekspear?</color> Well, alright then!

Y'know the drill! I'll need... <color=yellow>1 spear from them Mekboars and 15 Slimek Cores to keep it together,</color> and I'll make a nice partisan for ya in return. Sound good?
Evasion and critical strike chances increased by 5%. Max stamina increased by 5.
Evasion and critical strike chances increased by 5%. Max stamina increased by 10.
Evasion and critical strike chances increased by 10%. Max stamina increased by 10.
Evasion and critical strike chances increased by 10%. Max stamina increased by 15.
Evasion and critical strike chances increased by 15%. Max stamina increased by 15.
Evasion and critical strike chances increased by 15%. Max stamina increased by 20.
Defense decreased by 10. Movement speed decreased by 20%.
Grants invisibility and heals 5 health every 1.2 seconds. Attacking will remove the effect.
Grants invisibility and heals 5 health every 1.2 seconds. Attacking will remove the effect.
Grants invisibility and heals 5 health every 1.2 seconds. Attacking will remove the effect.
Grants invisibility and heals 5 health every 1.2 seconds. Attacking will remove the effect.

Forsaken demons who come from an aquatic realm tangled with hellish machinery. By their own will, the Imps were not able to think or act for themselves, following orders from the occult who often summoned them.
An ancient but thriving race of dryads who are tactful and cunning. Poons have adapted beyond being prey from the Deep Forest, able to take on any foe that stands against them.
Reptillian hermits who are naturally adept in the use of magic. The Kubold's homeland resides within a distant arid desert, sealed by arcane energies.
Elegant and dexterious travellers, and likely to be materialistic. Once matured, Byrdles are sworn to leave their flock from their kingdom to find their eternal destiny.
Compact, yet sturdy. Always eager for adventure beyond their scope. Changs come from a mysteriously advanced civilization, but were often outcasts and seen as troublemakers.

Bueno... veamos que puedes hacer, ¿te parece?
Bueno... veamos que puedemos hacer, ¿esta bien?
A este mundo le vendraía bien un poco de pureza, ¿no?
Mi conocimiento es tuyo, en que puedo ayudarte?
Estas en el santuario, la ultima fortaleza de la paz de este mundo corrompido...
Ninguna creatura del mal puede entrar mientras este aqui. Asi lo quizo el destino, Estare Aqui solo para que el santuario este seguro.
Soy uno de los 3 guardianes que han vigilado esta tierra desde sus comienzos.
Antes podia verlo todo, pero mi magia se ha debilitado por... circuntancias desafortunadas.
Todo lo que puedo hacer ahora es mantener este mundo roto conectado, mantener el escudo del santuario Y alejarlo de la oscuridad.
Sin mi magia, tu alma estaria atrapada, Y perdida para siempre... Atascado en un lugar desconocido.
Ten Fe, Hay muchas almas como la tuya que podrian heredar estas tierras puras.
Manten tu determinacion, Y manten tu cabeza en alto... Creo en ti.
Oh? T-tu estas interezado en mis estudios?
Perdona, no es muy comun que me pregunten esto.
Eligir ser un mistico desbloquea todo el potencial de tu mente, dandote la habilidad de ejecutar poderos hechizos.
Puedes protegernos a nosostros con una barrera, Lanzar Estacas Explosivas, Y Atravesar objectivos cercanos...
Explicandolo Resumidamente, La magia arcana de los misticos usa tu propia energia...
Eso abarca muchas cosas, No te parece?
Tu no eres de este mundo, Pequeño. Una vez fuiste un ser vivo en un mundo muy distante al nuestro.
Cualquier cosa pudo haber ocurrido, de eso no tengo certeza...
He convocado tu alma, de entre muchas otras, para que vivas una vez mas, Y protejas este mundo de la oscuridad.
Me asegurare que tu alma se mantenga pura Y protegida de aquello que aceche fuera del santuario.
Esta es otra oportunidad para tu vida, no crees?
Entiendo que esto te parezca inquietante...
Sin embargo, El purgatorio despues de la muerte no es un tormento que merezcas sufrir. Tu alma descansa mejor en este lugar.
De eso estoy muy segura, Pequeño...
Que alivio ver que mi llamado a resultado... Por un momento pense que tu alma se habia perdido.
Soy Angela Flux, La guardiana mistica del santuario.
Se que tienes algunas preguntas por hacer...
Pero primero, Conozcamos un poco este lugar, No?
Ah, Si... Esta si es una tarea en la que debemos centrarnos.
Porfavor ten cuidado... El mundo haya afuera es impredecible.
Tengo Fe en que tendras exito, aventurero...
Buen trabajo... Nos queda un largo camino por recorrer.
Oh, Maravilloso! Te dare una gran recompenza...
Haz demostrado ser un regalo para nosotros...
Una cosa menos de la que preocuparse....
Definitivamente, Tendras una recompenza por tus hazañas...
Bien hecho, porfavor descansa en cuanto puedas...
No hay preguntas que deje sin responder.
Soy Enok, Guardian luchador. represento lo feroz que es la luz, asediando el infierno Y la oscuridad.
Supongo que eres nuevo en este lugar. pero haz llegado tarde, en una epoca en la que todo esta corrompido.
Mis poderes otorgan fuerza y vitalidad a aquellas almas que hayan probado ser dignas de poseerlo.
Siento una chispa de determinacion en ti. Sucumbe al miedo, Y fallaras.
Un alma perdida puede ser un luchador feroz una vez ha probado ser lo suficientemente fuerte.
Un luchador puede desgarrar a sus oponentes, y masacrarlos en una lluvia de sangre.
Un luchador puede arrasar todo a su paso, con un golpe directo, un asedio letal a distancia.
Hace falta un enfoque intensivo para dominar todo lo necesario para el arte del combate.
Si crees que tienes lo necesario, ven conmigo, Y podre enseñarte.
Veamos si esto es de tu talla.
Hoy es un gran dia para un baño de sangre.
Es hora de unir nuestras fuerzas.
Aturdir a tus oponentes es escencial en combate cuerpo a cuerpo.
Para aturdirlos, bloquea rapidamente antes de que inicien su ataque.
Si logras aturdirlos correctamente, no te costara energia el hacerlo.
Excepto que, tus oponentes deben que tener una fuerza relativa a la tuya para que sea efectivo.
Si luchas contra un enemigo y resulta ser mas fuerte que tu,
flaquearas en hacerlo y perderas tu energia con facilidad.
Observa tus enemigos con detenimiento. No hay nada imposible para ti si tienes una estrategia.
Parece ser que tenemos carne fresca.
Si buscas volverte fuerte y seguir el camino del valor, habla conmigo.
Si tienes algo que decir, Dilo ahora.
Te estas volviendo muy fuerte en estas travesias, Uno menos.
Me parece que he visto tu rostro antes... O tal vez no.
Gracias al cielo que el santuario esta a salvo.
Oh si, Claro! Que vas a hacer en esta ocasion? Comprar O vender?
Oh si, Claro! Que vas a hacer en esta ocasion? Comprar O vender?
Nunca hay un mal dia para hacer negocios!
Oh? Tienes algo brillante para mi?
Si tienes algun intercambio por hacer, vuelve cuando quieras!
Si tienes algun intercambio por hacer, vuelve cuando quieras!
Siempre estare aqui dia y noche!
Ah, Ese es mi mimico mascota, Spike!. Descuida no muerde.
Es muy amistoso, Aunque tambien es un dolor de cabeza. No se que haria sin el.
Sabes?, Spike puede guardar tus objectos si no tienes espacio. No es genial?
Creo que tengo algo para ti!
Hay que ocuparse de algunas cosas!
Vaya, Vaya! Es agradable ver una nueva cara por estos lares!
Saludos! No creo haberte visto por aqui.
Es bueno ver a alguien nuevo por aqui!
Soy Sally! Bienvenido a mi tienda!
Tengo algunos bienes que te puedo vender, Pero tambien te puedo comprar! Si tienes algo valioso, traelo!
Muchos de mis amigos tambien estan dispersos por estas tierras! Saludalos de mi parte si los encuentras.
Haz me saber que puedo hacer por ti!
Siempre es un placer hacer negocios contigo!
Lo siento cariño, esto aqui no vale mucho.
No puedo quedarme con esto, Tal vez encuentres a alguien que si.
Esto no tiene mucho valor que digamos.
Hmm, Me temo que no puedo aceptar el trato.
Que hay de nuevo? Fue divertido?
Otro trabajo resulto, uno menos en la lista!
Has regresado invicto Cariño, Me agrada!
Hello my friend. Want to trade?
Interested in trading? (Hopefully you got something edible, I'm starving...)
I got some skill scrolls to sell!
Heh, funny you'd ask me that...
No need to worry. Them boars aren't all that menacing to me.
Though... the ones in the temple ahead seem a lil' scary. There's some treasure in there to loot, y'know...
If I could find some way to get in without gettin' murdered, I'd be makin' some good business.
Careful if ya ever consider going in there.
I've got some interestin' goods for ya. Figure to check them out?
Guess bein' out here ain't so bad.
Skrit's got a few good shinies in store...
Let's see where the ball drops...
Ehh? Perhaps Skrit didn't realize to tell ya.
Give some coin to Skrit, and ya may get somethin' good in return...
It's none of ya business where Skrit gets the goods though! Keep it quiet!
Ya can re-roll the stock Skrit offers as well, no charge! Ya just can't see it till' ya buy it.
Skrit serves better stock when ya get stronger in ya journey. Keep that in mind.
Ahh... yes yes yes, Skrit welcomes ya...
Thinkin' ya got some luck? Things not going the way ya want?
Skrit welcomes some coin to give ya potential advantage to ya journey...
Skrit knows his fair share of bad luck, but coin always talks. The shiny tilts the scale.
If ya got some to throw in, speak to Skrit, heheh...
Skrit thinks this is a deal.
You buy from Skrit, Skrit doesn't buy from ya!
Roo, Roo, Roo! (Justo a tiempo! Donde esta la mercancia?)
Sorry hun, this ain't worth much here.
Can't take it, mighta' need to find someone else who will.
Not much of a value on this one here.
Hmm, afraid I can't help ya on this trade.
Ah, yes. Have you sprung inspiration for a new look?
Are you ready to take on a new look?
What is the look that you seek?
Illusion Stones are the main source of my power, or rather, my service.
While not necessarily a currency, they are considered as a Trade Item.
Illusion Stones can be purchased for a high value, or be found from the outside world.
Each category you change your appearance in (Color, Head, Body), will cost one Illusion Stone each.
My services are not needed to apply vanity to your gear.
However, you will need Illusion Stones to do this task.
Seek your inventory menu, and press the vanity button on the top right corner of the Tab Menu to access your vanity slots.
All but weapons and rings can be vanitized.
The equipment slot you wish to vanitize must have something equipped to override the look.
You will not be able to transmogrify equipment that is higher level than you, so keep that in mind.
I take it you have many ideas with this new found knowledge, yes?
Greetings. I take it you may have some interest in me?
I am the Mirror of Illusion, Angela's construct. My voice can only be heard between myself and the one who chooses to speak to me.
Bring me Illusion Stones, and I can change your look permanently. Though, keep in mind that you cannot be in the form of another race.
Ehm, you need some enchanting done?
Hey! Don't startle me like that. Geeze.
Alright, hope you got the funds.
My services aren't cheap, so think hard.
Hm? Oh right, we can do that.
This better be something new for me to enchant...
Okay, so this is how enchanting works.
You give me a piece of equipment. Weapons or armor can do.
Depending on the equipment, it'll cost crowns. Rare items will additionally need trade items to enchant.
Make sure the equipment isn't formally exotic though, I can't enchant those.
Enchanting is a delicate process, and it's nearly impossible to choose which one you want.
Because of that, you will get a random enchantment each time.
I hope you understood all that. I would rather not give you the run-down again.
You sure about that? You might not be saying that after I kick your face in.
You know, some things are just better off being unsaid.
Yep, I'm Angela's apprentice. A Mystic, part of her studies.
I've branched off to study more on enchanting rather than studying offensive magic.
I think it's more chill. It makes good cash too, when things go well anyways.
I respect Angela. If it weren't for her, I wouldn't be here. You should respect her too.
Right. So, if you put an equippable weapon into the enchanting slot, you can change the damage scale of it.
Depending on what you wanna do, you're gonna need some stones to do this sort of thing.
For Strength, you'll need Might Stones.
Lastly, Mind requires Flux Stones. Got it? Anyways...
If the weapon is inherited to the scale you want, then it won't cost any stones. Cool, right?
The stones can be found around the world, but they can also be sold from vendors too.
The stones are pricy, so I won't cheap out on you and add more to the cost. So... you're welcome.
My specality is enchanting weapons and armor.
If you got some cash, I can probably help you out. Just ask nicely.
Sooo... what's it gonna be? You interested in my services?
How many times are we gonna do this now?
That doesn't look that bad, I guess.
Roll of the dice, as they say.
Hm, didn't think it'd come out this way.
The portal eminates an evil power! It's unlike any other portal you've seen before.
Strength defeats the weak! It's a known fact that Fighters have the upper hand.
Have you witnessed the strategy of Cyclone? It's my life long goal to learn it myself!
Enok is the guardian I worship. His determination and valor resonates with me.
I hope to see the world safe again. It doesn't seem like that'll happen.
Do you think the Sky Whale still watches us?
I've witnessed the Shattering. I used to live in the Effold Terrace.
Did you know you can breathe underwater? It's a blessing from Angela.
This water is so pure. We're so fortunate to have it.
This is the Sanctum Lake. We tend to relax here when times are rough.
Hm... I wonder what water spells are out there.
I've been practicing Fluxbolt. I can only get it to hit a couple times...
The sound of arcane magic brings me joy.
Imbue is a very powerful spell. It can make your melee weapons magical!
No time to chat, I'm trying to study something.
Hm... oh? Sorry, I can't talk right now.
Greetings. I see you have come to this world in peace.
My colleague thinks you look cute.
There's such little time to learn.
Hail, lost soul. Does this place entice you?
My colleague seems to like you.
These two don't know what it takes to be truly agile. If only they knew...
Nothing beats the power of wit and speed. Fighters and Mystics don't stand a chance against Bandits.
Have you spoken to Sally? She's remarkable.
It is quite clear that the way of the Mystic is far more superior than the others.
Spellcasting is the better option, there are no exceptions!
Angela knows best, and she's the one that knows more than the others.
I have quite a lot of things to study soon...
You've met Enok, correct? He is the Fighter Guardian.
My strength communes with Enok's powers.
I see you're not from this world. We're natives here. Lost souls are always welcome.
As long as you assist us in this dire time, you're free to rest here!
Master Enok knows of your presence. Don't disappoint him.
If only I could kill some slimes right now...
It's dangerous out there. I'd advise you to be prepared.
In case if you don't know, the portal to the outer sanctum opens when you have spoken to Angela.
If only the outside world was safe like it once was...
We try to keep Sanctum stocked with all the essentials.
How many bunbags do we have left? I lost count...
Hmm... I should talk to Sally just to make sure we have everything...
Agh, we seem to be low on carrot cake. I love that stuff!
I've got some training to do, I wanna beat up some slimes!
We're not strong enough to take on the world outside, but I wanna prove that wrong someday.
Between you and me, I can't wait to kick this guys ass!
What? You've lived in a world that isn't always overcast?
Hail, adventurer. This is the gateway to the Outer Sanctum.
I'm stationed here to guard Sanctum in case anything comes through.
Hm... how many chances have you had to prove yourself beyond this world?
I do wonder what other place out there in this world is as safe as here...
Have you been to the Crescent Keep? Rumor has it that it was once a temple of nature magic.
The Guardians seem to have predated our existance, but i've been told this isn't true.
It's too lovely here for me to leave. I'll be staying here.
Did you open the portal leading here?
Blessed day, Angela has not forgotten us!
Oh? I thought i'd never see anyone new here.
It seems the portal is opened here now... thank goodness!
Please rest here before going back out, and be careful!
How is Sanctum? I hope things are okay there.
Some say the Wall of the Stars can speak within your mind.
It's good to know we're not stranded here anymore...
We're so fortunate to have been stuck here rather than somewhere dangerous...
